Reviews.Title: “The price only”
Reviews.Author: AliJaadan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, the front disk are good but the refrigerator they given to me has brought a lot of noise which i could not stand. There is another noise which is coming from the windows or the heaters' pipes. The location is ok. There is no restaurant in this hotel so you need to bring some food/snacks in the room in case you are hungry. In my point of view, this is just a building which fit for budget travel only therefore if you have the money to stay in another hotel, i don't recommend this hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Janie P
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location and is reasonably priced. Lots of shops and restaurants around. Rooms are clean and well kept. Staff is great, and helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. Would return again on next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: bhotter1775
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my stay at the Hotel St. Denis and felt I had to give it some praise. When I arrived they gave me a parking pass to an indoor garage around the corner. After I parked I never went back to the garage till I left, three days later. The Merto is two blocks away and for $16.00 I got a 3 day pass and within minutes I could be at any major site or Resturant in Montreal They then showed me To my spotless room with all the fixings (refrigerator, iron, hair dryer,flat screen tv, bathrobe). The great bed gave me 3 nights of comfortable sleep. The staff was helpful and friendlyand made me feel at home. It Wasn't the Waldorf , but at that price, comfort and location, who needs it Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, everything else was only okay”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, in the Latin Quarter and within walking distance to a lot of bars and restaurants, as well as the subway. The price was also very good. The hotel itself though was showing its age in the lobby and hallways. The rooms had recently been renovated, but there was still a musty smell. The phone in the room didn't work, and despite our asking repeatedly, it never was fixed. They also charged my credit card $100 for not returning the access card to the parking garage, despite telling me that there was no need to return it. It took three phone calls before they removed that charge. All in all, a very good price for a very good location. But you have to be willing to put up with a lot. I would stay somewhere else if I had it to do over again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good bet”
Reviews.Author: travelcatadk
Reviews.Content: We travel to Montreal a lot and have stayed in many of the budget lodgings. We came back to the Hotel St. Denis because it stands out as being a good deal for the price. Parking is right around the corner, the rooms are clean, staff is friendly. The beds are super comfortable, too. We have always had rooms in the back, so it's very quiet. Location is great--within walking distance of the old city and the Plateau with a lot of good restaurants in between. They don't have breakfast at this hotel, but it's a good excuse to go to one of our favorite cafes, Cafe Lyonnaise just a couple blocks away. Really, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Pghmds
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Montreal before, I picked Hotel St. Denis and was not disappointed. The hotel is well placed by UQAM and therefore the neighborhood has many bars and restaurants as well as Berri-UQAM metro station, a crossing point of several metro lines. The rooms were clean and well-maintained and the staff were friendly and bilingual. Some noise from the hallway can filter in when your neighbors return, but the rooms are otherwise quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Real Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Itamar L
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very humble from the outside and also from the first glance to the lobby. But its perfect location and great rooms make St. Denis a real bargain. My wife and I spent 5 nights at St. Denis. Our room - standard - was huge, with two king size beds, two tables, a sofa, two chairs and seperated shower and toilets. The beds were among the most comfortable I've ever enjoyed in any hotel. The hotel is located a 3 minutes walk from Berri-QUAM metro station, one of the main stations in the city. There is a big supermarket 5 minutes from the hotel, so although the hotel doesn't serve breakfast, we had great meals in our room. There are also many cafes and restaurants around the hotel, as well as many shops especially in Rue St. Catherine. St. Denis is heartly recommended if you want to get a good base in a great location and in reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and good value”
Reviews.Author: bjoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at St-Denis for one night. We only paid $70 so we were not expecting much but were pleasantly surprised. While the room was basic and on the smaller side, it was enough room for a king size bed and a few desks/chairs, and it was clean with a newly renovated bathroom. The location is great too, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. I thought it was a really good value considering we only paid $70/night.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay when in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jan P
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here, and it was the perfect location for walking around the central city. We arrived by train, and it is even possible to walk from the station to the hotel if you do not have a lot of luggage. It is on the corner of St Denis and St Catherine: One way takes you up St Denis with all its great little shops and restaurants, the other way is a short walk to Old Town. Or head up St Catherine's for more shopping, galleries, and sights. Close to the metro. The hotel itself is small, very clean, undergoing upgrades. We were given a large room with two double beds, kitchen facilities (frig, microwave, coffee maker) and extra amenities like a heater. Given it was -22C outside, the room was warm, but nice to have that little extra boost of heat when first coming in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room we had was an inner room, and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/Cheap/Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: alisontheresealison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel St-Denis in November for 3 nights. The hotel room was clean and had hard wood floors which was a nice change from carpet! The people at the front desk were very helpful and gave us a map of montreal and even told us places we should go for dinner & drinks. The hotel was nicely located, close to the metro and a short walk to all the things you would want to see in Montreal. The parking was convenient and cheap compared to the other hotels I had looked at. Only downside was that you can hear people in the hallway easily because the walls are thin, but it wasn't that bad. Overall great hotel for an affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, quiet, big room”
Reviews.Author: Michele C
Reviews.Content: We needed a place for a night downtown Montreal close to the Metro and bus station. The St-Denis is very conveniently located just south of ST-Catherine. It is a great value for money. It is a small, older hotel, well maintained, clean, quiet and our triple room was quite big. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: JannyKevin
Reviews.Content: Weekend family trip to Montreal. Our room was on the 4th flr, very spacious and clean. Considering this is a 3 star hotel, we were very happy with it. Fabulous water pressure in the shower (very rare). Great bed and the pillows were wonderful. The hotel was wonderfully located. We parked the car and walked everywhere. The staff were very helpful and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and clean”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: I paid 105 CAD a night for a four night stay. I was very happy with what I got for this price. The room was clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. The ensuite was spacious and also quite clean. The reception staff all speak English and they were very helpful in assisting me with all my enquiries. There is a Metro station quite nearby. There are also many eateries and shops, including supermarkets, located within 5-10 minutes walk. You need to be aware that this hotel is located in the Latin Quarter. The district becomes rather "colourful" after dark. I would advise women against walking alone. If you are a solo travelling male like I was, be prepared to be offered a whole variety of illegal materials as you walk down Rue Saint Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: mankoo
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel last weekend for 2 nights, after searching high and low for a centrally located hotel, that was near everything but not too expensive. The location is not bad, it's near a club, which we already knew at the time of booking, and requested a room in the back. On the plus side, it's less than a couple minutes walk to the UQAM subway station. The room was small but really clean, and super quiet. Small but clean bathroom, I was happy. I loved the hardwood floors in the room, rather than the usual dirty carpets in hotels. The restaurant next door had one of the best eggs benedict (florentine) I've ever had. On the negative side - it seems like it used to be a smoking hotel, and it was quite apparent in the room. But on the whole, will definitely go again, the price can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “A bit small”
Reviews.Author: calgarybizlady
Reviews.Content: This is a typical European hotel..I was on the first floor so took the stairs (which I liked) Very small elevators and narrow halls. The room was VERY tiny, you would not be able to fit two people in the bathroom at the same time. However, I like the laminate floors, the bed was super comfy. It was not very soundproof and I was woken by people talking and partying through the night. It is walking distance to simply everything and the price was so reasonable through Expedia. It was listed as a 3 star hotel..I would consider it a 2.5 or 2. For the price and location I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Benicio
Reviews.Content: Great location 1 block from a restaurant and cafe district. 100 meters from the Berri Metro station and airport shuttle. Rooms are large with new fit out, large comfortable bed and plenty of room for luggage. Breakfast in the restaurant next door is of a very high standard. There really arent any negatives to report with this hotel. Stay here with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Stay”
Reviews.Author: BintiDad
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days and couldn't find anything to complain about. I asked for a quiet room and was given a very quiet room at the back. Everything worked well, the elevator and the A/C and the plumbing and all that. Hot water appeared quickly, no waiting 5 minute for it to work up from the basement or anything like that. Bed was firm and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. As others mentioned, I really liked the updated wood flooring in the room. The carpeting and trim in the corridors has seen better days, but that didn't really affect my stay. I would definitely stay at this hotel again on my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price and room, perfect location / assez bien”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTO
Reviews.Content: I got exactly what I was hoping for, at the price I paid: solid, clean, quiet room, VERY comfortable bed, polite service. If you aren't looking to stay in your room, this is a perfect place. (I was in town for hockey, and so I was out most of the time. When I came back, there was enough room for my equipment to dry out overnight.) It's near the central subway crossroads and the arts area, and the gay village and latin quarter. The (minor faults): Walls are a bit thin. The overnight parking is $16, not bad for Montreal; but the underground lot, next door, is down a rather sketchy street (Christin). The UQAM area is quite central, though parts of nearby Ste Catherine are a bit rough.

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget option that is clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The room was comfortable and clean. Bathroom very small. It is an older hotel that has been renovated a few years ago. The location (very close to the Metro and at a hub station) is excellent. You can get a train to the botanical gardens, Olympic stadium, Champ de Mars for the old part of town or just to go downtown. There is a good restaurant just next door that has good food,fair prices and a character for waiter - very entertaining and interesting! The free wi fi took a while to come on line but worked well afterwards. The desk staff were a bit detached but that is big cities. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at good price”
Reviews.Author: Matthew L
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for location and cost as it was significantly cheaper than other hotels in similar area for our dates but we were not disappointed ($100 per night). Rooms were large and clean with 3 double beds (amazing bargain if you had 6 willing to share). Location of this hotel is excellent and while there is a lot of sex related locations nearby I never felt unsafe and it is walkable to nearly all things we wanted to see and we found good bars and food nearby. I would stay here again if looking for similar budget as met all my criteria

Reviews.Title: “Three nights in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Iggy128
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based on pricing, being relatively close to "old Montreal", and reviews. Area is not the best, a little seedy, but we felt safe while walking around. Not many places to eat, except for a great Italian restaurant next to the hotel. Room was unremarkable, clean, dark (not enough lights), bed comfortable, but telephone was not in working order, and this was not clarified until the second day. We were offered to switch rooms, but it was not worthy. If I was to return to Montreal I would try to find something closer to the commercial center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Qakwan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to see Old Montreal, the Latin Quarter, and The Village on foot. Metro is close by. The staff are courteous. The price and the quality of the room were excellent given the location; in fact, the price would be equitable even out in some suburb. Parking is nearby and access is easy. Lots of restaurants and funky shopping a short walk away... in fact, the two nearest restaurants are immediately adjacent. We found the street to be lively and, yes, noisy, even from the fourth floor. We didn't expect downtown Montreal to be quiet, but it was a little surprising how much the noise carried; to be fair, we had the windows open all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: jrichardshaw
Reviews.Content: I was pretty impressed with the hotel. It more than met my expectations. As mentioned in another review, the wooden floors were a surprisingly nice touch. My room was clean, and pretty spacious. My only criticism is that it is pretty loud if your room faces out onto the street (Rue St-Denis) even with the window completely closed. It does quieten down late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SheilaRBS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Latin Quarter where there's lots of pedestrian traffic. There's no restaurant on site, but there's lots of store front eateries and restaurants in short walking distance. The metro and bus stops are in short walking distance as well. It's about a 10 minute walk from the hotel to Old Montreal. The staff is very friendly. Stayed there with my six year old daughter and had no worries. This is an older hotel, but the rooms were very clean. I especially like the hardwood floors in the room, instead of carpeting. If you like crepes, there's a fantastic crepe restaurant in Old Montreal named Muru located at 362 Rue Notre-Dame Est. Prices were reasonable and food was excellent!! Also, if you love a great steak, there's a great steakhouse in Old Montreal named Gibbys, located at 298 Place D'youville in Old Montreal. It's a bit pricey, but food is excellent. If you want a nice family style restaurant with a variety of foods and not very expensive, visit Denos on Saint-Denis Rue, a short walk from the hotel. There's just tons of eateries and dessert places within walking distance and the streets are safe to explore despite the appearance of some of the surrounding buildings. This is not a luxury hotel, but it's nice enough, especially for the budget conscious. There is no parking on site. The parking is around the corner, about a block or two away. Oh, one more thing, the air conditioning is supplied by window units and the heat is supplied by radiators. It wasn't a problem for me, and since I was there in August, the air conditioning unit cooled off the room, just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service for a small and basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveldish
Reviews.Content: I travel often to this part of Montreal and prefer smaller boutique type hotels. This was an older hotel with the basic amenities, but very clean. There was some fairly loud road noise however I discovered in the morning that the window was open a bit. There are many restaurants at your doorstep and the metro is only steps away. It is on the edge of a somewhat seedy block or so of town so I opted for the indoor parking offered by the hotel (just around the corner) for a reasonable price. There is also a covered parking at the UQAM library a block or so away. Try L'academie restaurant a few blocks past Sherbrooke on St. Denis. There is an SAQ across the street where you can buy and carry in a bottle of wine and the restaurant will uncork it at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “I always book this hotel while I'm in MontrÃ©al!”
Reviews.Author: SatanicSurferz
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel at least 7-8 times, either for work or for vacation, and I've never been let down. I always have a room with a king bed on the back of the hotel. Room is nothing fancy, but large enough and very clean. They replaced their carpet with hardwood floor imitation, which I like very much. Free Wi-Fi in the room, though it doesn't seem to always work. It's not an hotel for a romantic getaway, but the price is very good for the area, on the lively St-Denis street and one block from the Berri UQAM metro station (main hub, with orange, green and yellow lines) which can bring you anywhere in MontrÃ©al. There are many restaurants nearby (try the "Station des sports" if you want a sports bar that have cheap meals and beers) and it's an easy walk to downtown. Parking is just a block away from the hotel and is 16$/24h which is kind of cheap in MontrÃ©al. The only thing I don't like is when you have to check out, you have to go out of the parking garage, park somewhere not permitted and run to the hotel to bring back the parking card. Most of the staff are very friendly, helpful and smiling (I think I didn't like one clerk out of the 10-12 I saw... and it was just because he wasn't smiling, he was still more than OK). There's no lobby, just a small desk at the entrance... and staff do control who enters the hotel (no bums or prostitutes). Check in and check out has never been a problem. You can often find a room there for less than 100$ and again it's clean and very well located. This is why I'm always going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and free internet”
Reviews.Author: MaryMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: Saint Denis street is a vibrant artery in this Soho-esq area of Montreal. The hotel is located on St. Denis at the edge of the area amidst the buildings of a nearby university (this area is closer to the lesser important restaurants and somewhat less well kept. It's only a block to the subway. The building has art-deco details and a reasonable price (including free internet not easily found in commercial hotels in Canada). It's showing signs of wear however, is in urgent need of perhaps replacement of the carpeting (in the hallways), a sprucing up of the bathrooms or whatever. There is parking nearby provided by the hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine alternative to more expensive chains nearby”
Reviews.Author: JoeMP54
Reviews.Content: Everything, including coffee maker was clean. What I really liked were the floors of Pergo - hardwood imitation, which is shiny and easy to clean. No more hidden bacteria and germs common in h/motel room carpeting from everyone walking in with street germs and then your having to go barefoot and chance getting a fungus. I always find that gross. Room could use a clock/radio however, but that is a small inconvenience. Everyone has a cell phone with an alarm clock feature.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: suprgrover
Reviews.Content: Good location for Montreal nightlife. Our room was very spacious and the AC worked well. Beds were clean, as was the bathroom. On the edge of a rough area, and cars get broken into often in this part of town. If you stay here, you should take advantage of the indoor secure parking they offer (at an additional charge). Note on parking: its also for public use. If you want to take your can in and out of the parking garage, get the parking pass offered by the hotel. If you plan on parking it and leaving it for a few days, skip the hotel parking pass and use the posted rates.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for next year.”
Reviews.Author: steveNjana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the visitor to Montreal who wants a room to sleep in once their adventures in the city are over for the day. It is close to everything. More than reasonable rates for inner city lodging. It's not luxurious but all the other benefits make up for it. My only complaint was that the in window air conditioning unit was so loud.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location. But”
Reviews.Author: eeamonn
Reviews.Content: While I loved my stay at Hotel St-Denis, I can't really justify giving it more than a 3-3.5. The location is excellent, convenient to so many of the great neighborhoods in Montreal. The price is excellent. And in my opinion, these two things combined are pretty much the most important things I look for in a place to stay on vacation. So, I got what I wanted, and would likely stay here again. That said... Its not the greatest hotel. I agree, the rooms seemed clean... but in a no visible dirt, and bathroom smells very strong of bleach sort of way. The room smelled quite dingy, sometimes like old smoke, sometimes like mildew. The coffee maker also kinda grossed me out. I still used it, but I'm gross. Also, the power went out in our room twice. The staff was very friendly and fixed it promptly (just a breaker box switch), but it was still inconvenient. So, maybe we got the one lemon as far as the rooms go, not sure. And as I said, due to the price, location, and friendly staff, I'd still recommend this hotel to others. Just make sure you have you expectations set to a level on par with the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: ArianeWaut
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends at the hotel St-Denis in July 2011 for 4 nights. The hotel is located in the "Quartier Latin", dynamic neighborhood with many bars and restaurants and approx. 15â€™ walking from the old MontrÃ©al. The hotel is also located near an important metro station with connections to several lines (UQAM if I remember correctly). The rooms are clean, quite big (with a kingsize bed) and the bathroom is more than ok. No breakfast included, but there are many options in the nearby rue St Denis. Not really noisy (but our room was located at the end of the corridor on the backside, the rue St Denis is quite busy so it might be good to ask for the same) but the cleaning team was rather noisy in the morning (around 8 p.m.). I would definitely recommend this hotel. Good quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel--would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: WiseGirlTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short vacation to Montreal. We stayed at the Hotel St-Denis for 3 nights and it was perfect for the two of us. The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in the least expensive room and found it to be well-worth the money. The hotel is in the lively Latin Quarter which is full of young college people. It is close to the Metro and the bus station and only 4 Metro stops from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, clean and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: cecivear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, great location, near from the Old Port and main streets. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the bathroom is tiny but you can use to it, itÂ´s also very clean. It has Wireless internet, TV (most of the channels are in french), air conditioner; everything was great! Very kind staff, I recommend it for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: spitfire27
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great place! Inexpensive with an underground self-serve parking garage around the corner. Wood floors (instead of yucky stained carpet). Excellent staff -- helpful and bilingual. The rooms are quite large with sofa, work desk, high speed internet, two closets, a bureau, nightstand, and room AC. It's walking distance to Old Montreal. Rue St. Catherine is half block away. The Metro is a few blocks away. In July 2011 we paid $114 per room and $16 a day for parking. For Montreal in the tourist season, this is a fantastic deal. The St. Denis isn't a luxury hotel. It's clean, comfortable, convenient, and inexpensive. If it's a luxury hotel you want, there are plenty of them at double or triple the price. If you simply want a good place to stay on your visit to Montreal, don't look any farther -- this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Have visited twice, and loved it”
Reviews.Author: ronewman
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Rooms are very clean, quiet, comfortable. It's an older hotel, so if you want a modern, marble & glass cookie-cutter-room hotel, this isn't it. But the rooms are nice, the price is great, the staff very helpful. I've stayed twice, in two different rooms, and both were very quiet. The bathroom is small, as you'd expect in an older hotel, and there's no central air; but each room has a window a/c unit that you can set as you wish (although you may have to ask for instructions, as some of the icons on the unit are not intuitive). Floors have been replaced with woodgrain laminate, so the cleanliness is obvious. We had no idea what to expect the first time we stayed here; but I made a point of staying in the same hotel the 2nd time after my first good experience, and wasn't disappointed. It's a very short walk from the station where the 747 express airport bus picks up/drops off, adjacent to UQAM, and 2 blocks from a part of Rue St. Denis with lots of restaurants. You can walk to the old part of the city, but its a longish walk (15-20 minutes?) It's right by a metro stop, though.

Reviews.Title: “Old but decent value.”
Reviews.Author: JJFB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel St-Denis in July 2011. This Hotel is a good value and only four or five blocks from the Old City. The staff always greeted me with a "Bonjour!" You have to park in front of the hotel to unload your stuff, and then get a pass to park in the underground garage a half a block away. The garage was quite roomy and nice. The hotel is clearly an old building, but as we stayed in refurbished rooms, they were quite adequate. The elevator is slow as molasses, so I ended up taking a flight of stair two stories up to the room quite a bit. One room came with a mini-fridge and microwave, which was invalable as we generally ate our meals in our room. The surrounding area has a university feel, but still not the prettiest part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: wakeupgetdown
Reviews.Content: We reserved a budget room and upon arrival were upgraded to a regular room (at no extra cost). The room was quite nice -- all appliances were functioning, everything seemed very clean. Our electricity was on-and-off the first couple of hours we were there, but hotel staff dealt with the problem promptly. The location is good, not great. Most of the neighborhoods we were interested in seeing were a 10 or 15-minute walk away, but the Berri-UQAM metro is extremely convenient. Parking was around the corner and cost $16 CAD/day. I definitely recommend St Denis for travelers on a budget. I doubt you'll find a nicer place for $100 CAD/night.

Reviews.Title: “very good place to stay - bargain price”
Reviews.Author: extoronto
Reviews.Content: great location beside the uqam (university of quebec at montreal). easy walk to berri/uqam subway station - makes it easy to get around the city to get to sights. we had booked long ahead and got a no cost upgrade to a jacuzzi suite with refrigerator included. hotel conveniences are pretty basic. there was no alarm clock or any hotel info/phone books included in the room - but the rooms had just been repainted, and everything was very clean. and cleaning staff kept everything very clean during the stay. king size bed was quite comfortable. they offer wi-fi if you're travelling with your own laptop, but there is no computer in the lobby, or other internet access on site. front desk staff were always helpful, and provided marked up maps and attractions info on request. just down the street (2 blocks) from the st. denis theatre if you're there for the just for laughs fest, as we were. only consideration might be a recommendation for women not to wear ostentatious jewelry - as there are a number of street people in the area, and we had been warned by one of the neighbouring store clerks to be careful late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EmersonToronto1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel St-Denis from June 30 to July 3rd, 2011. The room was very clean and the staff was great. After a long day of sightseeing it was nice to go back to a clean and comfortable room to sleep. The location is very good with several options to eat near by, and the subway two blocks away. The front desk staff was kind, respectful, and helpful. Thank you for the great stay. We will certainly go back there when we visit Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff very friendly and helpful....”
Reviews.Author: JustJane_1971
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic but all you need when you are only sleeping there. We stayed here for 2 nights. The room was very clean and we felt safe. The location is good as the metro (train) is only 2 blocks away so access to everywhere was easy. This location is out of the touristy area which was also good as it wasn't too busy and noisy. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: flashpacker4822
Reviews.Content: This small hotel location on the edge of the old part of Montreal was exceeded my expectations! The location was great, the front desk staff was helpful & incredibly nice, the parking garage access was super easy and safe, clean bathroom and sheets on the beds, and the coffee makers in the room were a nice added bonus! It's pretty much no frills, but if you're traveling on a budget and want to be in a great location, I would recommend this hotel. Also, breakfast isn't included but there is a cute cafe next door. They also provide free wifi which was surprising since many 5 star hotels I've stayed at charge for a daily wifi use. Some people said that the hotel was noisy, but I didn't have a problem. We were on the back though, so that probably helped.

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot!”
Reviews.Author: travel_llama2
Reviews.Content: Went up to Montreal with my wife and brother-in-law (teenager) for a few days. We had never been and were looking for someplace affordable, convenient and safe. I'm always hesitant to book somewhat blindly, but there is no other choice... This turned out to be a great spot! The rooms were very large - 2 beds and a pull-out sofa. Each room is a little different I guess. Our's had wood floors and a simple NYC apartment sort of feel. Not much storage, but who needs it? So much open space our suitcases could just lay out and not be in the way. There are no real amenities here. No gym, no restaurant/bar as a part of the hotel. There is a restaurant/bar (decent sangria and desserts) downstairs in the adjacent building, but no affiliation so you can't bring drinks to your room or anything. The area was fine. It is a city. There is an unfortunately large homeless population in Montreal and you walk by some of these communities either going to the Old City or the Village. St. Denis itself had some fun restaurants about 2 blocks above the hotel. The village is all blocked for pedestrian traffic and seems to have events on the weekends. St. Catherine is right by the hotel and a few blocks from shopping areas. We walked about 6 miles one day all through the city - the metro is also easily accessible from the hotel and easy to use. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful in pointing out areas of the city we may want to see. We would definitely go back and stay at the St. Denis. The location was great for what we were looking for. The city seems very diverse, some trendy areas, the old city is gorgeous, super gay-friendly particularly obviously the village, great shops, food, etc etc. Parking was about $15 a day give or take. For 3 nights we paid $425 and didn't need our car start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, but not charming or family oriented”
Reviews.Author: BintManga
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic and apartment-like and the room was fine - clean, new, everything in good shape - but the hallways were narrow and the walls very thin and the street outside somewhat noisy and the neighbourhood slightly dirty and gritty though conveniently located between two nice areas to visit. I would not however recommend it for travelling with a child, as we did, because the room (medium size) is small and there is no public space for children, no lounge or lobby really and too much street noise. Also there is no breakfast and the downstairs cafe is more like a studenty hipster cafe than a hotel eating area, cramped and expensive. The front door has a tiny and steep ramp that makes it difficult to get in and out with a stroller or even a suitcase frankly. For most travelers none of this is a deal breaker and the hotel is certainly perfectly adequate. However, for the price, I did feel a bit like we were slumming it rather than travelling in comfort. P.S. The internet is free but quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MobileEm
Reviews.Content: My heart sank when I saw the location thinking it was going to be noisy. However, the noise did 'not' enter my room even though it was on the street front, and as an older person I enjoyed the buzz of the location when I was out amongst it. There are 'lots' of eating places up and down the street so breakfast not being served in the hotel isn't a problem. My room was a decent size. It was clean and the bed comfortable. There was a desk and free wi-fi with a good, reliable connection. The bathroom was "tiny" - as small as on a ship or train but without the ingenuity. But I managed and I figured the staff must be used to dealing with the extra towels you need to mop the floor with. The location was just a bit further than I wanted to walk to the old town or downtown but Berri-UQAM station is conveniently close by. I did in fact walk to the old town and anyone younger and fitter than me would do it easily. If you're visiting Montreal on a budget this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff that goes above and beyond; Nice, clean, inviting; GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: ImNotElvis
Reviews.Content: The staff is outstanding. We arrived late at night after an 8 hour drive on a rainy day/night. We had booked the hotel room through a reservation website which. We required 2 beds (4 people) but somehow the reservation sent to the hotel was for one bed. The hotel was almost fully booked. Other hotels usually take no responsibility for bookings made through reservation sites. But the night attendant at St-Denis, Hugo, was apologetic and tried to make every arrangement possible. He even took a look at a room that he thought might have just emptied out (but warned us that it would not have been cleaned yet). It turned out the room was still occupied. We agreed that we will settle for a mattress on the ground for the night. As far as he was concerned, he was done, all he could do. But it doesn't end there. While I went out to park the car, he kept looking and when I came back, he told us he'd found another empty room. So we would get a free room for the night. The next day we would get our 2-bed room (which, by the way, was large, clean and inviting). Hugo went above and beyond his obligations. Just because of staff like him, we will be back and will strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Montreal. Besides the outstanding staff, the location is excellent - Rue St Denis has the best crepe places, a myriad of quaint restaurants, an incredible little panini shop right next door. It's steps away from where FrancoFolie was taking place. The hotel rooms are beautifully done - it's no Ritz Carlton but it's got charm the Ritz can't provide. The best little hotel we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic room with very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: PJPS
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate at this hotel which is in the Latin Quarter and within walking distance of Old Town or the Metro is only a couple of blocks away. The room is basic but has a very comfortable king bed plus a desk and a couple of chairs. It looks like an old hotel, but has fresh paint and hardwood floors. The front desk staff is very friendly and welcoming. It is near a college and a group of young people were noisy when coming in during the middle of the night. Otherwise, we had no issues. I would highly recommend this hotel especially for leisure travelers and parents of students.

Reviews.Title: “It's a comfortable clean and restful Latin Quartier hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JRW5362
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel ST-Denis. It is a small, quiet, clean hotel with parking in the garage (not included in room rate) in back. It is on the edge of closed off for summer section of Rue ST Catherine and convenient to services there as well as services on Rue ST-Denis. The female clerks were more friendly than the reserved male clerk, but none were rude.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean... surpassed our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A2D2travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel St-Denis definitely surpassed our expectations. For the price we paid we expected much lower standards. I am not one to travel and 'rough it' but at the same time I don't like paying out the nose for my stays. This hotel is where I will stay the next time I am in Montreal. It is next door to several great restaurants (right next door to a fabulous sushi restaurant) and just a 5 minute walk from the vibrant street of St. Catherines and 10 minutes from the water/ the old port of Montreal. The number one travel standard I have is cleanliness. Our rooms were immaculate... which was such a relief. My partner and I agreed that we would definitely recommend Hotel St- Denis to travelers who want to save some money. The prices are great and the stay was as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and again!”
Reviews.Author: reciprocityyy
Reviews.Content: My best friend, her boyfriend and I went to Montreal for just one night. The hotel was very clean, quiet, spacious, and comfortable. The staff is great! Their English is very good, they're super helpful and we did not encounter one person within the hotel who wasn't friendly! Hotel St-Denis is located right downtown, within walking distance of many clubs, bars, restaurants, and stores. It was only $16 to park in the parking garage for a full 24 hours. It's not super fancy, but it's a very nice, convenient place to stay on a budget. We plan to stay here the next time we head up to Montreal. Great service, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great ! Affordable ! Friendly ! Clean !”
Reviews.Author: Sostraone
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, great location, walking distance to the main attractions. The rates are good, it's clean with wood floor , a great point ! The staff is friendly, very helpful and always. A Great place to stay closed to everything.

Reviews.Title: “No-frills budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: shock66
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Hotel St-Denis to anyone staying in Montreal on a budget; it's cheap and very clean, perfect for people who are just spending the night. But you get what you pay for. The walls are paper thin (not the best thing on New Year's Eve weekend) and the room amenities are very basic. In fact, our room's heater was broken in the "on" position and so the room was boiling hot. I managed to fix the heater myself and I don't blame the hotel for the broken equipment (I'm sure no one reported it) but it was an added annoyance. Bottom line: The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, and it's cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kitty52_10
Reviews.Content: Rooms and common areas were very clean and pleasant. The staff was very helpful. Location is convenient to that part of the city. Parking garage was nearby and we were able to leave our car there 24 hours for one reasonable fee. Cabs were easily available to get to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean Lodging”
Reviews.Author: trixieto50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a quick overnight combined business/leisure trip to Montreal. We usually stay in 4-5 star hotels but most of the ones in Montreal were unavailable and the ones that were available had a very high rates and terrible reviews! In Montreal, one can stay in a small "auberge" or European style hotel like the St-Denis that are not fancy but very clean and well-run. The St-Denis was very clean, which is a top priority for us when we travel. The room we had was basic but spacious. The floors were laminate hardwood and spotless. I liked the fact that the windows open and that the heat is from radiators. The hotel is in an university area and I felt safe walking at night. Montreal, generally, is a little seedy, and there are alot of homeless people but not once did I feel threatened. There are lots of coffee shops, cafes and shops less than a five minute walk from the hotel. The Metro stop is less than two minutes walk as well. The front desk staff were very pleasant, efficient and helpful. I almost felt like I was in a small village in Spain or France while in the St-Denis. The parking is around the corner in an underground lot. As a conclusion, we were not in Montreal to hang out at our hotel. The St-Denis provided us with a clean place to sleep for one night at a very good price for downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Montreal Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: carpsenior
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. Most recently Oct 1 2010. Less than Cdn$100. Includes high speed internet. 1 1/2 blocks to Montreal Metro (subway). 6 blocks to Old Montreal. Just for Laughs festival out the door. Room was clean, bed comfortable. Restaurant next door and another 1/2 block away on Rene Levesque serve breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: rj088
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed in this hotel for a three day side-trip to Montreal. It's located just outside of the Latin Quarter which is loaded with many interesting shops & restaurant. The hotel is really an old building. As such, you can hear the water pipes and your neighbours when they're opening doors or walking through the hallways. But, the good news is that the hotel room is clean, spacious and the staff is friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again. It's good value for the money. It's also near the main Metro station, which makes it easily accessible for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jphnyc
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a room with 2 beds for me and my friend on Labor Day weekend. When I checked in, I was informed that the room I booked had some plumbing problems so the hotel gave me 2 rooms with 1 king bed each and a jacuzzi - and yep, I still paid as if I only had 1 room since that was my original booking. My friend and I appreciated that inadvertent and smooth upgrade. The hotel's rate is a great value - we paid $105 Canadian a night on a holiday weekend. The rooms are spacious and clean, although there's not much of a view (you face the windows of other rooms) but that's not an issue for me so it was no big deal. The usual in-room amenities were there, including free wifi. Location is good - it's a block away from the Berri-UQAM metro station, which is one of the main arteries of the Montreal metro system. All the bars, restaurants and bistros on rue St. Denis, as well as rue Ste. Catherine are mere minutes away by foot. On a nice day, you can even walk from the hotel to Centre-Ville (downtown) pretty easily. This place isn't a 5-star hotel, but it's not a dump either. If you're looking for a clean, comfortable and convenient place to sleep in, and don't need the extra luxurious amenities (i.e. gym, spa, pool), then this place is ideal. Would definitely consider staying here again on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean room”
Reviews.Author: travellaureen
Reviews.Content: Nice and big rooms. No carpet in the room but an 'wooden" floor, whice is nice and more hygienic. Realy good value and on a good location, the subway was realy close by, restaunts were on walking distange. Only down side is the neighbourhood. There were al lot of bums, not realy nice, especialy at night. But on the otherhand there were al lot of bums everywere in Montreal (wich I found really supprising). Tip: realy nice coffee and sandwiches at SoupSoupe a few houses down the street. p.s..the highspeed internet wasn't that high

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality-price rate”
Reviews.Author: Winston-le-chat
Reviews.Content: I had a good overall experience. I've spent 7 nights in this hotel and I'm completely satisfied with the service and with my room. The room was comfortable (great bed), quiet and spacious (compared to the British standard!!) and although the furniture was quite old (the room looks a little bit out of date) I don't have anything negative to say. I've noticed some scratches on the wall of the bathroom, but then, again, I personally don't care. The bathroom was perfectly cleaned each morning, and so was my room, even when I left late in the morning. A few details. The wifi is completely free and, since I was there for work, I really appreciated this service. The hotel is 1 min from the metro-station UQAM and also 10min by foot from the heart of St Denis (restaurants, pubs, tea-rooms, coffee shops...). Also the main bus station (where the bus from/to the airport arrives) is 10 min by foot. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Zarla
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better location. Great neighborhood with lots of shops/restaurant. Wonderful cafe (KIlo Cafe) and restaurant next door. People at the reception desk were very nice and helpful (except one who was quite unfriendly). Room was great and had been recently redone. It was very quite as we were not on the street. We didn't hear any noise from the other rooms. The only negative thing was the noise of the air conditioning units from the other rooms that we could hear when we opened the window to sleep. All in all great value for money ! We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The essential, nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: Invictus_33
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal over the weekend and spent an unexpected night at the St-Denis. I arrived without reservation and was able to book a room right away. The rate was standard for a downtown Montreal hotel: $129.00 per night (two double beds). I was happy to see that my CAA card got me a 10% discount. With $16.00 overnight underground parking, the night came up to just over $150.00. Unfortunetly, the parking was around the street, and the parking lot itself was a little confusing. Beyond that, the hotel is in an old building and tries to maintain some of the charm. Narrow stairs can take you up to your room. I was on the 2nd floor, so I didn't bother with the elevator. The room itself offered the essentials, desk, couch (not sure if it was a pull out), two twin beds and a split bathroom (shower in a closet size room and toilet and sink in another). This did come in handy for getting ready to hit the town. The shower did offer an overhead showerhead as well as your standard wall mounted showerhead. A nice touch, although I felt the money invested to install this could have been better spend somewhere else. The room itself didn't offer a view, looked over a small courtyard with other rooms accross the way. I just kept the blinds closed to avoid having on lookers. Overall, for the price and location, this was a simple solution for finding something right downtown on short notice. However, if I had to plan ahead, I probably would consider staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Maxtravel50
Reviews.Content: St Denis is a great little place. Fantastic location and my room was very clean. Staff are friendly. My only reservation is that rooms can be noisy. The rooms at the front can get noise at weekend from nearby clubs, esp in the wee hours when people are turning out. Rooms at the back get noise from large airconditioners on roof of building facing. And the airconditioners are noisy, although I did not use much. I tend to be a bit neurotic about these things (you might not be) and I was able to move rooms when I mentioned my noise problem to staff (but alas not a total solution given most rooms face either front or back). But would I stay here again? I think so.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with great location”
Reviews.Author: KWtraveler4ever
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and use this hotel every time we travel to the city. Parking is a breeze with underground parking just around the corner. The garage has reserved spots for hotel guests which is helpful as parking in this area can be tricky. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. They are bi-lingual making asking directions, etc very easy. The location is perfect. Just a block from a major metro station, but we walked everywhere and at all times of the day/night. The neighborhood is busy all night so there really are no fears of walking. Rooms are basic, but you get what you pay for. This is an old hotel so rooms are too small for a comfy easy chair. Instead our room had a desk/chair and another plain chair. King size bed was very comfy. Wifi is free and all you need to do is ask the front desk for the login/password information and you can use your wifi enabled phone/laptop/ipad to check email, surf the web, etc. The wifi worked perfect each time I used it. The one problem I had was that the room was a bit noisy in the morning. Garbage pickup at the university behind the hotel woke me up on 2 mornings. The one morning it was very loud and I came to find out that my traveling companion had left the window opened as the room was stuffy. Yes, you can open the windows, but I would not recommend as it is VERY noisy out back behind the hotel. The room we stayed in was 109 and I think this is the second time we have gotten this room. We will be back in August and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Anyelikk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel St. Denis this past weekend. The Hotel is located 1.5 blocks from the Berri-UQAM metro station. The Hotel overall was a clean, the bed was very confortable, there were nice faux wood floors (better than carpet), and the bathroom was very clean/up-to-date. Additionally, the front desk staff were helpful and pleasant. We're not sure of the price we paid, because it came as a package deal with our airfare. We expect the price to be reasonable, though, since our package deal was very inexpensive. The only complaints we had were: 1) It was nice that our room had a fridge but it was noisy so we unplugged it. 2) There were a group of young girls staying across the the hall and we could hear them clearly late at night. (poor door insulation) 3) The hotels is an older building (with radiators) and in places had a little bit of an old smell. Although not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “very good bargain”
Reviews.Author: funnyguy14
Reviews.Content: Large renovated room, very clean. Great location just a few minutes away from old montreal and the downtown area...friendly and helpfull staff...i highly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “great bargain”
Reviews.Author: Peregrinator5
Reviews.Content: For the money--the location and excellent staff cannot be beat. I've been going to Montreal for over a decade and this is the only hotel I bother to book. End of story.

Reviews.Title: “Merci for making my trip great!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCBlondeNyc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 times in the past 2 years and have nothing but great things to say!! The location is the best, the rooms are clean and comfortable, a very reasonable price and the staff are always helpful and kind. I highly recommend Hotel St. Denis!

Reviews.Title: “would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: mute_suds
Reviews.Content: NEGATIVE - Way to expensive for what it is â€“ no way is this a 3 star hotel (I would say a 1 or 2 star hotel). - Paid parking â€“ the parking lot was around the corner but the entrance was on a dodgy alley. For the price paid you had in-and-out privileges, though. - Breakfast was not included â€“ and if you decided to purchase the breakfast it was taken on the caffe next door (canâ€™t comment on the quality of it though). - The staff was never friendly. - The room had a strange smell and bathroom could be better cleaned. - The corridors and stairs were really narrow â€“ it was hard carrying the bags around. You can also hear everything that goes on in the corridors â€“ it was difficult to sleep in the morning after the cleaning of the rooms started because of all the noise made by the maids. - There was no view from the window (which was rather small). Note, if you book this hotel via an external internet website, like expedia, please note that the price does not include tax which may be higher than you expect (if Iâ€™m not mistaken the tax was 16%). POSITIVE - Free fast wifi internet. - Good location â€“ in a very active area of town with lots of bars, restaurants, caffes and other activities. Within walking distance to the centre of Montreal (15 mins walking). CONCLUSION: would never stay here again - it's a really sad place which overcharges you completely (as I wrote, no way this is a 3 star hotel). Can't really understand the other positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: toseetheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Sept. 2009. I would recommend this hotel. The surrounding area and hotel itself seems un-appealing on first appearance but improves as time goes by. The hotel is an older building and the hallways and tiny elevator look somewhat shabby. However, the room itself is very clean. The bed is pretty comfortable. They have hardwood floors. When I arrived, there was no remote control for the TV and the reception desk said I would have to wait till the next day for them to get one set up. They provide a free wireless internet connection thatâ€™s fairly quick. The rate included breakfast. The hotel gives you a card for breakfast at the restaurant next door, Pacini. The breakfast option consisted of either 2 eggs with bacon/ham/sausage or yogurt with fruit. The restaurant has an all you can eat bread bar with super delicious jams. The location is excellent. Itâ€™s about a 10 minute walk to Old Montreal. Itâ€™s a few steps away from a subway station. Itâ€™s also within walking distance to all the restaurants on Rue St. Denis. (Highly recommend Juliette et Chocolat, esp. if you are a chocolate lover) Parking costs $15/night.

Reviews.Title: “Economy Room: Clean, quiet and comfy bed, but tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: Helix_ATL
Reviews.Content: Economy room runs about $95 and is super-small! There's barely room to walk around the bed or even stretch our your arms in the bathroom or shower; good luck finding space to open up the ironing board or finding space to set the coffee maker. However, the room was spotlessly clean and the bed was the most comfy that I have ever experienced in a hotel room! Window unit air conditioner was noisy but worked well; bathroom exhaust fan was broken and hardly worked at all. Basic TV has a modest selection of channels. This room is overall fine for a solo traveler but would be tight for two. Peacefully quiet, my room was not facing the street. The staff were courteous and helpful. This is a great location for those who want easy access to a multi-line metro station, just 2 short blocks away, and easy, short walk to Latin Quarter, Old Town and gay village. This is a perfectly fine hotel for the no-frills budget traveler who is looking for a clean, quiet retreat for a moment and plans to spend the majority of time out seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: tiaras
Reviews.Content: we booked 3 nights-2 nights then up north for a few days and then 1 night on our return. first visit the room was grand. in general i think for the price it was fine, some of the staff were great and some not so great but no one was unfriendly. first visit we got a non smoking room as requested but sadly they had forgotten and we had a smoking room which stank esp as we found the ice bucket had not been emptied and it was full of cig ends......not good i know stuff happens.....but there is no excuse for that. place was full so we couldnt change to non smoking. i wouldnt stay here again but only because of the location-for us it was not the best i would go towards rue roy direction but otherwise the hotel is fine as long as you are not going there to stay in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overrated place. Romantics, stand back”
Reviews.Author: MoroseMilan
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the raving reviews... I absolutely can't understand why people are so excited about this place. The front desk is ok, polite, but I won't say friendly. The corridors and the carpet are really in bad shape and not engaging at all. My room was terrible, very small, no bed light, only a ceiling yellow light, ugly courtyard view, and the bathroom (closet size) has a air system so noisy that you want to get out asap. Very clean, however. And free wifi appreciate! But in general, this hotel is a perfect illustration of what the words anti glamour means.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: appaloosas3
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the reviews and was quite pleased. Hotel is right between Latin Quarter and Old Montreal, perfect for walking and subway very close by. The front desk is so helpful. The room was spotless, quiet, comfy bed, lots of pillows and updated bathroom. Parking garage right around the corner and no need for the car, you can walk or ride the subway. Loads of restaurants, safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not much else....”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_SJ
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel based on the reviews of trip advisors. We were looking for a good location in the middle of the quartier latin to give us a feel of urban life in Montreal and Hotel St-Denis did in fact deliver this. Univ of Quebec at Montreal is right across the street. Rue St Catherine is one block away and it is full of life and has everything you can imagine (park, church, grocery store, pharmacy, eateries, pubs and many more...). The subway station is also just a 5 minute walk. . Our teenager just loved the whole urban scene.. Other than the location, I thought St. Denis was just an average place. The bldg is old and it looks like there was some recent remodeling done. The beds were firm and comfy and the bathroom was laid out weirdly but clean. The Air Cond was loud but we were so exhausted from exploring the city all day that we weren't too bothered. When it turned cool in the morning my husband turned off the AC and that's when we realized how loud it was. Our room window looked right into someone else window so we have the drape partially closed during the little time we were in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Once again it was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: sidecarOttawa
Reviews.Content: We went to Hotel St-Denis again this year and were pleasantly surprised by the new wood floor they put in the room. It is a a nice touch! The location is obviously excellent and the staff that was working on this particular week-end wass joyfull and ready to help. They even lend us an umbrella for the night. For sure we will be back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel located in busy area”
Reviews.Author: BR_Travellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel St-Denis is an old building (which was renovated!). Therefore, our room was pretty small, as well as the bathroom. The hallways looked pretty dated, but the bedroom was ok. It was clean and comfortable, despite the size. The staff was really friendly and the hotel offered free wireless internet. The only really bad thing is that the street was really busy even at night and the air conditioning was too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: over50connecticut
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I wanted to go away for our anniversary without stepping on a plane, so off in the car to Montreal. We had a package deal for two nights that included parking and one breakfast. It was WELL worth it, true there are no fancy soaps and shampoos, but our room was large and CLEAN, we barely heard a peep from any of the other guests. This being our first trip to Montreal, the location was fabulous, we were walking distance from the old port and were right in the latin quarter. The two restaurants on either side of the hotel are great too. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “modest perfection”
Reviews.Author: proscenium
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Denis is not a fancy-pants place. It is simple and understated. But the location is very central and would really suit a traveller who doesn't want to be in the commercial centre at a big Hilton or in a similar major chain hotel. The rooms are very clean and tastefully decorated. Wonderful wooden - not carpeted - floors. It is comfortable, cozy, quiet, and it's easy to get anywhere in Montreal from here, especially Old Montreal, but also the major museums and the University and the many shops, restaurants, cafes, bars and neighbourhoods nearby. I'm in a room with a king size bed - extremely good mattress - and I'm appreciating the free wifi and the big enough TV. Extremely good value, and I'd stay here again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYVacationMaven
Reviews.Content: St. Denis is in the heart of the Latin Quarter, which is the heart of Montreal. The St. Denis is probably one of the best values. It's not opulent, but impeccably clean, with great service. Right next to a Bixi bicycle rental station, of which there are 300 throughout Montreal and the best way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,clean hotel...TINY bathroom but big room!”
Reviews.Author: europeangirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel St denis for 4 night at the end of may. The location is second to none-right in the middle of all the action(bars&restaurants,clubs,sightseeing,metro,bus station). Rue St Denis is mainly the french-speaking going out area which I loved, lots of jazz clubs,trendy bars and really laid back. Very safe area and we never saw any trouble even walking home at 3am! We got a very reasonable rate of 92$ a night plus tax online and from the reviews on TA we knew the rooms may not be the best out there,but for the price they were fine-they were bang on. Let me say the bed was the comfiest ive ever slept on,with crisp white sheets. Large TV, desk and chair.wooden floors in the room which i liked instead of carpet! only problem was the bathroom,it was seriously tiny.If you stand in the middle and stretch out your arms-you can touch either side!! The shower left just enough room to stand in it, good powerful shower tho! The bathroom so small they had the sink out in the main room which looked quite odd and there were no shelves to put any toiletries....all minor quibbles but this is a review after all! The whole hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, there was good free wireless internet and the location was perfect....I would recommned this to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: ScubagirlToronto
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the latin Quarter, close to subway and short walk to old Montreal. Also very close to the Mont Royal Plateau.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: eds_the_boss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequently visit Montreal both for personal and business reasons and, as a result, have stayed at many different hotels throughout the city. Hotel St Denis is the one hotel which has consistently provided us with clean, spacious rooms, attentive and courteous staff, and very reasonable rates. The fact that this hotel is centrally located, is literally surrounded by quality restaurants, and within minutes of the metro is only a bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, Love it!”
Reviews.Author: KStout
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location and it had everything we needed. This was my second time here and both times I had a very pleasant stay. I booked the budget room, a smaller room, but we were just sleeping in it so the size of it didnt matter. This room also had a mini fridge which was great for keeping water and beer cold. It looked as if our room on the second floor was just redone- It had nice, very clean hardwood floor and new shower and tile. I would have to say that the bed is the most comfortable one that I have ever slept on. The bathroom is quite small (in the budget room) with no bath tub, but it was suitable. Our room was facing St Denis street, and even with the window cracked at night, we didnt wake up due to noise outside. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, they answered all of our questions and directed us to montreals "hot spots". The hotel rooms come with free wifi interent, you just need to ask the front desk for the code and they can give it to you. Parking is right around the corner with a secure garage with video survalliance for $15 Cad. a day, which is not too bad for parking in the city. Overall, this hotel is great. I have read the bad reviews and I just think that those people are expecting much more than what they are paying for, this isnt the Hilton, it is a cute, well kept, very clean hotel in the heart of montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, Cute and Clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: baa219
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Expedia for only $58 a night - i wasn't expecting much at this price, but I was pleasantly shocked. The receptionist was very pleasant, the room smelled as if had just been renovated (that new construction smell), the facilities were clean and new-looking, and it had the most comfortable bed i have ever slept on. I did not want to leave this hotel. The only small drawbacks are that the internet was very slow and that the building itself is old and the heating is centrally controlled, so my boyfriend was too hot one night and was told the only way to make the room cooler was to open the window a crack. Otherwise I cannot speak highly enough of this small, great-value hotel. Very centrally located- close to pretty much everything, as well as a central Metro stop. I was able to walk here from the bus station in about 5 mins. Also the cafe attached to the hotel has good food (amazing desserts) and is reasonably priced. And you don't have to go out in the freezing weather to enter it! Also, our room, facing an interior courtyard, was extremely quiet - I don't know about rooms facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “"High price for such a bad service".”
Reviews.Author: lidsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. The room we booked was the Budget room for 90$ + tax. Parking and breakfast were not included so we paid 12 dollars extra for parking. We ended up paying 123$ for staying one night. The room and bathroom were very small and damp, however they were clean. I won't recommend this hotel to my friends. You can find better hotels with the same price and much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: edda1981
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for one week while visiting our friend in MontrÃ©al. We mainly chose this hotel because our friend lives in the next street so it was convenient to stay at this location. The location is excellent, only a few minute walk to a big metro station, very close to Chinatown, St Catherine street (shopping, restaurants...) and the St Denis street has a lot of restaurants and shops also. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean and comfortable in size. The air conditioning was a bit loud and there came a bad smell when we turned it on so we just had the window open. There's a nightclub close by at the St Denis street so in the weekend there was a bit of a noise from the street. Also in the morning around 8 there was a cleaning truck or something like that on the street that made a bit of noise, but nothing horrible. Just normal big city life noise I would say. If you're looking for a basic clean room at a good location then this is a good choise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: MacStudent13
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had taken the greyhound bus from Toronto, and the hotel was walking distance from the Greyhound station and the Metro station. The hotel was very nice and cozy and the staff was very helpful. We got a regular room and it was very clean and a decent size also. The location is the most important thing about this hotel! It is close to EVERYTHING, and the street is very old-fashioned and has a wonderful feeling to it. The rates were very reasonable also, and the restaurant next door is amazing for any meal. Our first time in Montreal was an amazing experience, and it will now become a yearly thing. I will definitely be going back to Hotel St. Denis!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Xenawantsapony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and some friends stayed here 1 night en route from the 'Super Aqua Club' to Ottawa. The location was excellent to enjoy the Just For Laughs festival. The location is also excellent if you want to walk to Old Montreal, Chinatown, shopping on St. Catherine Street, the restaurants in the Latin Quarter, and the subway. The price was good for accomodations during the festival. The rooms are very basic and could use new carpets and a paint job, however the bathrooms are extremely clean and the beds are comfortable. Amenities are very basic. Although the building is dated, it did not have that old hotel musty smell. Some street noise could be heard in the early morning but the air conditioner could drown it out. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again during the festival, however I would find the rooms a bit overpriced at other times in the year.

Reviews.Title: “The worst reservation experience”
Reviews.Author: qwerty2008
Reviews.Content: Before starting I must say that my rating is not for the hotel but for their attitude. I never stayed at this hotel. I tried to make a reservation for the Grand Prix weekend. All the hotels were fully booked, and I could just find this only room in this hotel for some 200+ CAD. We were going 3 people, and I gave the lady on the phone all the details including my credit card information. At the end of the phone call she asked me to confirm the details and she started to tell me everything back. She must have misheard me, and right after she said "for one person", I corrected her and said it is for 3, not 1. She said that room is not good for 3 people but 2 max. So, she didn't let me reserve the room for 3, and I said ok, I am not booking it then. A week later, I saw that amount had been charged on my credit card. I called them immediately. They couldn't find my name in the computer. They asked me to call a couple of days later to talk to Catherine (I don't know how to spell her name), the manager. I called them on that day and no one picked up my phone. After like 6 calls at different times on the same day, finally I could talk to someone who connected me to Catherine. I told her the story. And she said "your story is hard to believe." She couldn't find my name in the computer either. Then she put me on hold to go through some stuff. Later, I guess she found that amount had been charged for no show for the room "I booked". I repeated once again that I had never booked the room. She said "the one you talked to must have told you everything correctly, and you must have misunderstood. I don't believe your story and I won't refund this amount back." This conversation lasted for a couple more minutes as I was going insane. Then she finally said, ok, I will refund it but I still don't believe you. I go to Montreal very often, but I don't think I will ever stay at that hotel in the future. The hotel may be nice but this experience was enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldillusion
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Hotel St. Denis in March 2006, and I'm just getting around to writing a review now. It is very good value for money. I think we paid about $75.00/room per night. The rooms were clean, well maintained and elegant. The location is in the heart of downtown Montreal. There is a lovely restaurant next door that serves a great breakfast. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and price!”
Reviews.Author: sVT_traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel St. Denis. The location in the latin Quarter is unbeatable, a close walk to all sorts of great restaurants, museums and concert venues. And a hop, skip and jump to the metro! The neighborhood is pretty nice and seemed relatively safe. Since it IS a city, you might hear a lot of noise in the alleyways at night, but overall nothing too terrible. Parking for the hotel is around the corner, and when we stayed the rate as 12 dollars a day at the garage, not bad for the city. Our room was clean and roomy and the front desk staff was very nice. The hotel is right next to a cute little bar/eatery called Kilo, which seems to have a young, hip vibe and makes some great sandwiches (I recommend the mango and chevre panini!). Also included in your Hotel stay are vouchers for breakfast at the neighboring eatery, Pacini. Certainly beats your usual continental breakfast of stale bagels with your usual hotel stay! Overall, we would definitely stay here again, the location and price and quality for your dollar are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onekingdown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 14th and 15th for a weekend getaway. We booked 2 large rooms to accomodate our 6 person party. Each room had 2 queen beds and a sofa with a pull out bed. Because of a cancellation we didn't need to use the pull out bed but it seemed like it would be about the size of a double bed. The rooms were basic and very large. We were impressed with how much room there was with plenty of closet space for 3 people. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean and quite acceptable. Our experiences with the front desk staff were very good. They were extremely helpful and willing to answer any and all questions we had. The cleaning staff seemed thorough, though we didn't use them in the room I stayed in because a member of our party was ill for most of the second day. A particular bright sport for us was cafe/bar attached to the hotel, Kilo. They had delicious sandwiches and desserts and excellent drink specials from 4-9 (2 for 1 beers for as little as $3.50, amazing deal compared to prices in normal bars in Montreal). The staff at the restaurant were very friendly and gave us good recommendations on where to go for a night out. We spent both early evenings here taking advantage of the nice atmosphere and prices. Probably the best thing about the hotel is the location. You're a couple minute walk from bars and restaurants, about a 10 minute walk from Chinatown and about 15-20 to the heart of Old Montreal. Overall, I was very pleased with our experience with Hotel St Denis. The hotel isn't a destination in itself but it is definitely an exceptional base to explore Montreal at a reasonable price without sacrificing service.

Reviews.Title: “Really good trip, Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: BcHappycamper
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal last week-end and the trip was excellent. The room was clean and calm. The staff was professional and they were going out of their way to help us with finding restaurants and attractions. Yes, the hotel is located downtown with all the starnge people on the street but as soon as we pass the doors of the hotel... Everything is peaceful and confortable. For sure i will be back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can do a lot better in Montreal, without spending a lot more.”
Reviews.Author: nycdave
Reviews.Content: Oftentimes, reading reviews on TripAdvisor, I wonder if other reviewers are grading based on an absolute level of quality, or on the relative value provided. Having stayed at the St-Denis, I can only conclude that it has earned such a high score on the basis of its low cost. Even then, that must be based on the high season, because on my visit this November, some great hotels I'd been to (the Omni, the Kutuma) were only a little bit more expensive. To put it simply, the loss of quality was not worth the savings in money. I will give the hotel credit where due: It was clean. It was worn down a bit (old stains on the carpet and furniture), but clearly not un-cared for or unsanitary. Housekeeping was quite thorough. The location was excellent for those wanting to be close to all the metros, and a mere block away from the gay village. My praise must end there. The walls were exceedingly thin -- or at least the floors and ceiling were, as my friend and I were frequently disturbed by noise from our downstairs neighbors or from the hallway. The bed linens, though clean, were as worn-down as the rest of the room, and certainly not of a "3 Star" quality (who gives those stars out anyways?).
